text: I am so so surprised the pork legs were so delicious! Thank you open this restaurant in Las Vegas!! My family were so happy!!

Amazing food, worst service in Chinatown.

FOOD: The bossam is definitely worth getting. The medium is good for 3 to 4 people to share. The bossam is a steam pork belly dish where you wrap the meat with various pickled veggies. The napjak bulgogi is my favorite here. It is pretty much a bulgogi pancake and has a lot of flavor. I highly recommend the galbi tang, it is the best Korean soup with soft beef that falls off the bowl and clear noodles.

DRINK: Free soda with check-in!

SERVICE: The service here is horrible! They keep giving me the wrong orders and then they blame me saying I order the wrong thing. No accommodation whatsoever. The check came out and they also charged us for food we didn't order. Every time you ask for anything, the waiters have to check with their managers. I love their food, but I've been here multiple times and end up with problems each time.

Came here again for dinner with some other friends the other night on a Saturday evening. We had came here early so parking, tables/seating was ample. 

We were immediately seated, surprisingly the same exactly table as I did last time except my friend sat where I sat. 

We each got our own soups. #10 Garigukbap, #11 Garionmyun, #12 Spicy Garigukbap. 

Spicy Garigukbap is Beef Brisket Spicy Soup. Since i had gotten the Garigukbap last time, I am one to try something different the next time ! This is considerably different from the Garigukbap. I half expected the only change is that its spicy with the same ingredients and preparation. Guess not. Instead of big slices of brisket with tofu, egg strips, and a ball of noodles, it contains tons of napa cabbage and daikon with strips of brisket. In a way, it reminds me of yukaejang or maybe gamjatang. I was hoping to find some potato... Lol Not sure if i liked this that much. It has mild amount of spice but i think i prefer the normal Garigukbap more. 

Garigukbap is Beef Brisket Soup. Ox bone soup base with huge slices of brisket topped with egg strips, logs of tofu, and a ball of noodles. Very simple and clean tasting. Pre-seasoned with salt. 

Garionmyun is Beef Brisket Soup w/ Noodles. Same idea as garigukbap but with noodles instead. same noodles as the small ball of noodles in the garigukbap but more in quantity. The one who ate this said the soup was a bit bland, but i'm not familiar with her tastes. 

There's a free soda with yelp check in but none of us wanted a soda. We originally got hot tea, but two of us ended up getting some cold water cuz we got too hot eating our soups XD 

Probably get the normal garigukbap from now on. Simple and easy. Maybe i'll get to try their lunch specials at some point in time.

This place was a bit of a hidden treasure. I would never have considered going here just driving by. But I was pleasantly surprised. 

I got the Garion noodles, and it was delicious. The broth was clean and refreshing. But to those who like LOTS of flavor, it may be a bit on the bland side.

I also had the mandoo, and it was good. Can tell it was handmade. I tried a little bit of this and that from others in mY group and everyone enjoyed what was ordered. 

I'm looking forward to going back for the galbijjim and some of the other dishes. Definitely recommend.

Update: I returned and tried the fried rice... not really what I was expecting. It was.. ok. Probably won't get it again though. 

My mom got the galbi tang, and it's the first time in Vegas I tasted broth that true to the galbi tang. Even my mom, the pickiest and judgiest... gave her stamp of approval for the soups.

Food was good, the meat looked a bit weird. One lady was rude, but the rest of the employees were nice. I would have gave 5 stars if it weren't for that one rude girl. They also didn't refill my water, where's the service at?

Simple yet tasty. 

My friend and I tried this place for the first time for lunch today. We both got a lunch combo meal. I had the #3 which was the grilled seasoned beef and beef brisket spicy soup and we both shared an order of mandu. Overall, our orders were good and tasty. I do wish the soup came with a bit more meat. And I wish they had more of a variety on their banchan. 

I may have to come back to try other items on their menu. Overall, I'd recommend this place if you're looking to venture outside of a Korean BBQ meal.

I've definitely had better korean taste of restaurant than this place. I've ordered spicy garigukbap and it was salty as hell. The meats are so tiny in that salty soup. Service was so slow even there was no customers except us.
Hands down the BEST soup I've had in awhile!! So tasty and I love that it was boiling hot when it came out! The beef brisket with noodles was sooo good! You gotta order the biggest bowl possible! Lol

My third time visit, cannot ask for more except liquor.

Food: Good
Price: Good
Service: Good
Parking: Good

Best Korean food in the Las Vegas!!!!!
We went there for lunch and the food and service is outstanding.  Soup and pork bulgogi combo was very delicious and meat was tender. Kimchi was the steal of the show.

Being pregnant and suffering from morning sickness, I was struck with a huge craving for Korean dumpling soup. If that ain't comfort food I dunno what is. Looked this place up on yelp and stopped in for lunch. The mandu is handmade. Very flavorful as well as the soup broth. The soup comes with three big dumplings that I could barely finish. 

I might return tomorrow for lunch again. I can see this soup is going to be something I am going to crave throughout my pregnancy.

Although I hate to admit it, I've been binge'ing kdramas for the past few months. So much that lately I am constantly craving Korean food especially stew, specifically galbi tang. It's come to the point where I purchased a instapot to make it at home-but I'll leave that for another day lol. 

Back to my review. The restaurant is clean and nice, not too big not too small. When you walk in, there's this cool area to the right behind a glass wall where they display a huge pot where they make their broth. Didn't really get to take a good look at it because my daughter was running around but that was what the waitress told us. 

There's a pony wall separating the kitchen and dine in area. This is pretty cool because when you press the little button on your table for service, the waitresses all yell out "daeeeee" which I think translates to "yes" in English (someone feel free to correct me). Then you just say what you need - just like they do on my kdramas :) oh and if you're looking for the silverware, look for a little drawer in the front of your table - YOU'RE WELCOME!

Ok, now on to the food. They have a pretty legit lunch special so if you can go during this time, I highly recommend it! My husband got a brisket soup + plate of bbq meat for $15. He loved it! I of course got the galbi tang and it was freaking delicious! The broth was super tasty and not oily at all! The galbi was super soft and tender. I just dumped my rice in the pot and went to town! The only thing I was missing was some salt! They serve it with the soup soy sauce which isn't bad but not my preference. We also ordered the kimchi fried rice which was good too - my favorite part is the rice that sticks to the bottom and is super crunchy! Yummmm!!!

This restaurant just opened today and me and my friend came here for soft open! Restaurant is really clean and they treated me with pleasured service. Food are also very good! Their main menus which are Suyuk Jorbal and Bossam were very delicious and it made me to re-visit this place. I think this restaurant is one of the best Korean restaurant in Las Vegas! Must try it!!! I'm sure you will love this place and their food

I came to Garionban on one of their soft opening days. We ordered the galbi tang, manduguk, and bossam and yangeym jokbal. Everything was delicious and the service was excellent! I will definitely be back for more!

New Korean soup restaurant just opened today! Came with my colleagues for dinner and had galbijjim and garigukbap. The marinated beef bone was so soft and tender. And it tasted really good with sauce that comes with. And Garigukbap was one of their main soup with beef brisket which was also taste delicious. I could say that this is  the best korean soup restaurant among other korean soup restaurent. I think this place is MUUUUCH better than Tang Tang Tang! They said this brand came directly from seoul, south Korea. People should come this restaurant to taste authentic korean food! :)

garionban..

It's a clean restaurant. Even though it was lunch, we were seated right away.They have good service at this restaurant. The food is delicious and their bossam is something I recommend from this restaurant. However, I don't have any bad comments about the restaurant but if you're curious about this place, honestly I recommend you come here and try out their food.

Delicious! Had the suyuk pig ankle and pickled radish fried rice. I ordered the Large size portion for the pig ankle plate for 3 people and it was the perfect amount of food. The pickled radish fried rice was a good size for the 3 of us to share as well. If you don't eat a lot at once, this meal was just the right portions for 3 people to enjoy and not overeat. The inside is very clean and music is not too loud. The utensils and napkins are a part of the table so you dont have to ask, I really like that. But here is where improvement is needed, there were many unpolished and dirty utensils that it took me digging through 6 of them to find a decently clean one. The best thing about this restaurant I enjoyed regarding service, is that they have a button for service on the table so they don't keep bothering or bombarding during eating time. I like to eat in peace once the food is out. I usually dislike that about korean restaurants when the server comes to check on the table too much while I'm eating. The waiters have an eye for when the customer needs something. Great job!

I'm very happy with my experience here. Being korean I'm a food critic as is . I came with my husband and baby. Ordered Bosam and lunch combo bulgogi came with soup. Soup was delicious but wish the lunch portion of bulgogi was larger . We ordered another side of meat . Food was good . I'd suggest there to be more ban chans . Since I cannot feed toddler Kimchi ! Other wise than that it was good food !
This place is awesome!! One of the waitress was really sweet;) I definitely come back again! Also, the food was perfect. I highly recommend this restaurant to everybody.

LOVE. The best! I love bossam!! I got my first experience in Ktown in LA. I really wished I found places that good but here comes garionban to save me!

We got the large bossam to share between 4 people. I came twice within a month and got bossam both times but the most recent time I got a bone broth with some noodles. To be honest, I forget what it's called but I asked our server. 

Wrap up them pork bellies with the lettuce or that leaf they have. Add some of that kimchi, raw garlic, red paste, jalepeno, and bite! Yummmm. Amazing!! Just typing this review is making me hungry.

Just go and order it!! I brought my friends that live in SF while they're here for a week and they've come back twice already! Just do iiiitttt.
Spicy Garigukbob with steamed dumplings are hella yummy! I really liked the services of those staffs too! Must visit if you love Korean food :)

Came here with some friends for dinner. This is my First time at this restaurant and I am always willing to try something  new.  The restaurant is located in the same plaza as 8 ounce. Now the place is smaller than your average restaurant but there is ample seating. We had a party of 9 and there was plenty of room. We had ordered some dumplings along with Garigukbap the brisket soup and a bowl of rice. Also a a dish with a mixture of vegetables and some pork. The vegetables were really fresh and The food is really good. The service was great the staff are very friendly and attentive they removed dishes right away and our water glasses were never empty. If you like K Korean food give this place a try you won't be disappointed. I will be returning here again and again.

this place is pretty nice and cool. the mandoo was really good. the soup was really hot but the beef was cut in too small of pcs but service was really good. it might be i went very early. i will go back again to try other food they have next time

Flavorful, filling soups that warm the soul. He has spicy brisket soup, I had brisket soup with noodles. The broth has good flavor, and the freshest vegetables and tender meat are used to complete the dish. 

The Mandu dumplings are huge flying saucers of steamed goodness. Atmosphere is vibrant, cleaner than clean, and our server was super friendly and accommodating with replenishing the kimchi and radish banchan side dishes. Give this place a go!
These people know how to make and serve amazing Korean foods. Please stay there until I come back to Las Vegas and have Soju next time.

Brand new restaurant! Came from Korea because it got so famous in Korea! The foods were really good, even better than I expected! I strongly recommend this place. The new generation of Korean restaurant.

Finally!!! A place in Vegas to go for some good jjokbal!! Aka pig trotters. I have been here twice and both times did not disappoint!
The seasoned jjokbal was really tasty, but the flavor we chose was too spicy for me personally. So, if you can't handle heat like myself I would pass on the spicy option if you want to enjoy your food. You also can't go wrong with some good bossam (boiled pork belly) if you prefer your pork less salty. However my favorite is always the classic su-yook jjokbal!! I definitely appreciate the presentation and the banchan(side dishes) that come with it. Definitely a burst of goodness when you wrap the pork trotters in the lettuce with a bit of garlic and side dishes on top!
If you're in a soupy mood, I HIGHLY recommend the galbi tang!! Best in town for sure in my opinion. The hubby destroyed the entire bowl! 
I would say it is on the pricier side for the plates but if you're coming with a group it isn't that bad and totally worth it!!

Best Korean food in town. Love their combination #16 and beef short rib soup. It's a large portion of the combination even it's a medium size, so I always pack the rest for to go. Great customer service too!

The soup here is awesome. Galbi Tabf which is a beef short rib soup tastes so good. I love it so much. The manager there is so nice. Every time we go there he is always so patient to explain the menu, his service is top of line. I go there at least twice a week.

Actual rating: 4

Service: friendly

Price: $$ 

Ordered: flat bulgogi and brisket soul

Specialty: brisket soup

Quality of food: good

Revisit: yes

Parking: free parking
     Finding space: easy  

Lounge Cleanliness: clean
Bathroom: n/a

Overall:
 the brisket soup was very light, clean and refreshing.  it was on the slight bland side but I guess if it wasn't it wouldn't give you the clean taste to it.  my mom is very picky with korean food bc she makes hers from scratch. however she really liked the soup.

flat bulgogi: this had a lot of flavor. it is basically flattened out bulgogi.  you can't go wrong with this one. 

I wish they would have a little more options on the menu and a little more banchan (side dishes) it would have gone great with gogi (beef). who doesn't like more banchan.

If you thought it was helpful, please hit those buttons [helpful, funny, cool or send me a compliment ]  Thank you and happy eating!

Bossam (pork belly) = to die for! Try it! It complimented the sides perfectly! They don't start you off with only a few sides such as kimchi etc. Unlike other Korean restaurants that loads you up with plenty of side dishes to choose from. The dumplings are delish! Must try! The seats are super uncomfortable, but the tables with the little drawers and the call bells are really neat :) The staff was surprisingly friendly, but there was definitely a language barrier. The jokbal wasn't my fave however. Majority of the dish was fat & bone. Not sure if it's suppose to be like that, but it was super salty too. Overall, cute little spot, food is good, service is alright... it's a must try :)
Will not be returning for the soup at this place.  The #12 Spicy Soup for $11.99 have 3 small pieces of meat.

It's clean inside and has recent Korean style of tables. And that's it..
Food costs were higher and the quantity were less than any other Korean restaurants nearby.
You will be hungry soon after having one Garigukbap for dinner unless you choose a meal of Lunch specials only a at lunch time..
Servers were not professional at all..
I better goto Tang Tang Tang or other places than here..

This Resturant is OKAY. The flavors are simple, not mind blowing or anything. I only got the Garigukbap, beef brisket soup. It was a simple beef soup with tofu, noodles and tender slices of beef. I didn't realized one of the sides with onions and jalapeños was the soy sauce that made the beef more flavorful. I put that in top of my rice and ate it with the beef. I could see myself eating this if I were sick, don't have a lot of taste buds, and want a homemade type soup. 

Maybe other things on the menu are better. I wanted to try the Manduguk, but the server said the dumplings were a little spicy. I didn't want anything too spicy. 

Service is good. Sad to say, the resturant didn't impress me enough to come back.

My last meal in Vegas was here. Originally my friends and I were going to eat at the ramen place across the street. But because the wait time was long, we decided to try this place. Seeing as it just newly opened with good reviews, we gave it a try.

Just FYI there is a LONG WAIT FOR FOOD. I had a party of 6. I ordered a #8 Beef Brisket Noodle Soup with Grilled pork. We waited about 20 mins for the noodle soup to come out. But the grilled pork didn't come out til about another 30 mins later. My friends waited 40 mins for their food to finally show up. The table next to us was getting mad that they waited almost an hour for their food and still nothing! The staff was very apologetic and tried to get their understanding that there's only 1 cook. To me, it seems like the entire staff is in the back kitchen working but no food is coming out. What gives?! They have a small menu. The soup shouldn't take too long if they had one giant pot of broth ready. And the meat isn't even that big so IDK what their deal is. They gotta step it up for lunch rushes if they want to do well.

Anywho, food wise, it was wonderful. I actually really enjoyed the noodle soup. It was a huge bowl. Thankfully I was sharing with a friend or else I would have been stuffed before the pork arrived. The broth was very flavorful, meat was great, and the noodles were just right. The pork was good but there weren't too many pieces. It did come with rice as well so imagine this huge meal for 1 person. The onions sadly were still a bit raw. Wish it was grilled as well.

FYI, if you need utensils, check the left or right under the table. There is this little slide out drawer with napkins, chopsticks, spoons.

I'm giving this place a 3 star only because the wait was too long. Food is great, I hope they don't change that once they speed up the processes.

They said the first Korean chain restaurant in Las Vegas.  
Not that great when it comes to flavor. I had to put tons of soy sauce to my beef brisket soup. I am used to very flavorful food. Tried it once. Dont think I will be back. A little bit pricy for my taste. I'll take ramen or pho anytime.

Stop in for lunch and can't wait to go back.  3 months in business - I think this is a hidden gem.  Although only a few customers there at the time, they will get busy once the word gets out.  

Impressed with the food preparation - very authentic, had side dishes with meal served with hot tea.  

Soup/broth was the best I have ever tasted - was not expecting that.  I'm not a big fan of soups - I guess I never had anything close to this.

I'll be back for sure.

Authentic and tasty newer Korean restaurant on Spring Mountain!!

- Served hot tea with your meal 
- Small selection of banchan (side dishes) however the kkakdugi and kimchi are ripe and delish!
- Friendly and attentive servers 
- Quaint and cozy ambiance 
- Large portions! Great for sharing when dining in groups. The medium order of pork belly and pork leg is an excellent app for 3+ people  
- Great Bossam!! (boiled pork belly - was not too fatty) came with all the delicious pairings! The spicy radish was on point 

Overall a wonderful experience at Garionban. Will definitely have to try their soups during the next visit!

I'm a foodie and super picky about Korean food but this place blew me away. Everything literally everything is amazing! Even the kimchi and the radish appetizers are so delicious. For those of you who care about rice even the rice is done well. I ordered both the hamburger like bulgogi and the galbitang and I can say categorically that no norcal Korean restaurant and maybe only one other socal restaurant comes close to the quality. Note that this is not your typical korean bbq place so you have to be open minded about trying things you normally haven't if you are not accustomed to korean food. Amazingly delicious!

Food Quality: The food was extremely good. We got the Special Combo 15 Grilled Pork and Seasoned Pork Leg with Red Pepper Paste, Handmade Mandu, and fried rice. The food was really good but if I were to recommend anything definitely get the mandu. They were larger than I expected and super super good.

Customer Service: The service was pretty bad. We sat down and no one asked us what we wanted to drink until 10 minutes of us sitting there. It took another 10 minutes for them to realize they haven't taken our order. We ordered our food and the gentleman said "Are you sure I think this is too much food for just you two?" and we said "We know, we just want to take it home too afterwords." Then he just walked away. Then as we finished up and packed up our leftovers we were saying thank you and good bye and they just stared at us and went back in the kitchen.

All in all food is great but service is mediocre.

In the last two weeks, many things have improved from garionban. I believe the restaurant originated in Seoul, South Korea. They have soups, galbi jiim, jokbal, and bossam. The restaurant is very clean and is always a great dining experience. 

The first time we went, we had grilled pork galbi and seasoned jokbal, which was mixed with grilled veggies and sweet and soy sauce. We've had mandu both times we have gone and since I was there two weeks ago, they have become more flavorful and it was something myself and my family have all enjoyed. We had the bossam and grilled pork galbi this time. Each time, the size medium has been perfect for 3 people. We also got a soup our first time that was also very good. It's priced pretty reasonably and we've spent about $60-70 each time. 

The service has gotten better and they have worked out a lot of their kinks from when they first opened. I highly recommend getting the homemade mandu, a bossam or jokbal combo plate and will definitely be trying the galbi jiim next time! We look forward to coming back here!

Garionban is one of my favorite Korean restaurants in Vegas. I used to only frequent Soyo (bleh), Hobak or 8 (kbbq) and  (soup galore)....but since Garionban has burst into Chinatown, I know what my go-to spot for  will be. 

Tangtangtang also has a very good pork bossam, however, their specialty is soup and they often run out of the bossam, especially on the weekends. This place, however, has yet to disappoint with lack of menu items. The side dishes while few, are plenty good quality wise. Just the right amount of crunch and spice.

I have ordered every soup on the menu- all so good and nice to wash down the rice. 

I have only ordered the Bossam combo because I love it so much. There is a nice ratio of fatty pieces to meaty pieces, good for people who like one or the other or a variety, and they give you lots of veggies and will bring out more  wraps like the cabbage or perilla leaf. I think the only think I wish they added into their greens would be the green pepper that isn't spicy, but just a nice crunch that you can dip into their soy bean paste. 

I am so happy that they have these sorts of places popping up now because I truly miss the authentic places in Buena Park/Ktown in LA. This reminds me of home, and frankly is better than even some of my favorite places back home.

Plus, they had a free soda with a check-in. So make sure you check this place out.

Atmosphere and service is great. Just like in Korea. Food tastes almost the same as home. But Large size of serving is too big, medium size is totally enough. Unless there is a big group i don't recommend to order big size dish.

I gave this place a 3 star because the amount of food is so little for the price you pay. We went here for lunch and each of us ordered their lunch combo. Each combo costs about $13-$15 depending on what you want. I ordered their beef soup with dumpling combo. The food came out and it was just 3 pieces of dumplings, 2 side dishes which were kimchi and radish and the soup was just some veggies with beef. I've been to other korean restaurants and they provided at least 4-5 side dishes with the food. I suggest they either lower the price of the food or add more side dishes for their customers. Won't be coming back here again if I don't see anything change.

"Let's get Korean" announces Midwest poker bud.  "Kalbi, spicy pork, bulgogi" he continues.

"Korean sounds great!"  I say as my fellow Asian poker buds nod in agreement.  "Pig trotters!"  I continue.

"Pig trotters?  Oh come on.  Why don't you guys eat normal food?"  he whines.

Guess who gorged himself on those trotters.

Garionban offers up, a different kind of sharable Korean dining experience.  It's not KBBQ, you won't smell like eau de kalbi when you're done.  The flavors are familiar and the experience social.  Need more convincing?  Koreans traditionally drink while eating this meal.

Two sharable plates stand out.  Sold in two sizes (M for 2, L for 3-4).  Our party of four ordered L of each and finished, barely.

Bossam - pork belly braised with what seems to be ginger, onions, fermented bean paste and spices, sliced thin and served with napa cabbage, chilies, slivered garlic, pickled fermented radish, chili sauce and fermented shrimp sauces.  Take a leaf, add a slice or two of pork, dress it, then eat.  The pork itself, tender, the fat well rendered and adds to the richness.

Jokbal - well braised and seasoned pork trotters.  Somewhat sweet, with hints of ginger, star anise and cinnamon and a warming chili heat.   Very porky, the fat, sweet and supple, the skin providing good chew.  Same set of sides.  Same eating method.

Sharable plates also include a grilled pork (seokgalbi) and braised short rib (galbi jjim).  Several soups in individual portions also avaialble.  None sampled.

The only downside, the restaurant doesn't have its liquor license yet and this food begs for some Korean beer or soju.

Good but minimal Asian service.

Came in for their soft opening today. We ordered the Galbi Tang, Manduguk, and the special combo of Bossam and Yangneym Jokbal w/ the sweet sauce. Sides included kimchi, marinated onion, and spicy daikon. Everything was very flavorful. The sauce for the Yangneym Jokbal tasted great but was a tad bit spicy for me. The galbi in the Galbi tang was very tender. I especially liked the flavor of the bossam. I just wish the cabbage they provided was a little easier to wrap.

Atmosphere and decor is very modern. Overall, it was a good experience. And since this place is fairly close to my work, I would like to come back for their lunch special.

Very impressed with the food and portion!  We ordered the Grilled Pork and Seasoned Pork Leg Combo Special in large ($55.99) for 3 adults and 2 children. It was more than enough food! We even had leftovers.  The meat was very flavorful and seasoned well. The pork leg was very spicy, but tender and delicious. And that's saying a lot for someone who doesn't normally eat this dish!

Went to lunch second times.  My first time experience was great even though their service was little slow.  But this time....oh my god.   They don't even know what to do and how to handle customers.   I ordered their specialty " garion noodle soup ". They said they are out of broth.  It was 12:30 pm and the place was empty and out of broth?  What kind of restaurant was that?  So I ordered spicy garion kook bop( spicy beef soup) and spicy cold noodle.  Salty like ocean. In cold noodle, their was no topping at all except slices cabbages.  We asked warm water, it never came out.  It was my last time to go to this unorganized and bad taste restaurant.  Their competitor Tang Tang Tang is much better service and tasty.

The food was terrible.
Actually soup base is ok,but inside meat and vegetables are not enough.
Banchan is not enough and no taste.
The employee was kind but they are slowly and woowangjwawang(^^very not organized)
The interior was great but food was terrible.
Little too salty for all menu I ordered, but generally decent korean food I have been craiving for

I came to eat during lunch. Food was good, but when trying to pay, their POS device was inoperable! To make matters worse, they couldn't open their cash register. My choice was to wait for the manager or pay cash. Since I did not know how long it would take for the manager to come and its my lunch break, I had to pay cash to the only bills I had without change in return. This definitely is a problem!
My food was just too salty. I think they may not be using much artificial seasoning but saltiness lingered for long time even after I poured lots of water. What are they thinking?

Vegas have always lacked Korean restaurants and I'm not talking bout Korean BBQ. I'm talking about your authentic Korean establishments that specialize in a specific dish. I have always traveled to SoCal for my Korean fix but recently, Vegas has been trying really hard to keep their locals in the city. Kkulmat opened, TangTangTang opened, and there are even some pocha places that have opened! I have yet to try them ... but what I HAVE tried is garionban. 

Garionban's soft opening was today! Their very first day! They are opened from 11:00 am to 11:00pm. My husband and I have decided to come here for dinner. 

The establishment is very modern and very clean! I love their layout! Their tables are awesome too. They remind me of restaurants in Korea where their tables have a compartment for utensils. It's where they keep all the tissues, chopsticks, and spoons. That way, it doesn't take up room on your table and the servers don't accidentally forget to get you your utensils. 

Garionban specializes in ox bone soup and no matter which soup you get, the base is the same. The only difference between the soups is what they put in the soup for you. Aside from that, they have large dishes for everyone to share, such as bossam (sliced pork belly with condiments), jokbal (boiled pork slices), and galbijjim (braised short ribs). They also have mandus!! Mandus are dumplings and garionban hand makes them! My husband went with their garigukbap while I went with their spicy garigukbap. We also decided to get one order of their mandus to share. Also, I'm not really sure what garigukbap is ... I know gukbap is rice with hot soup. They said that "gari" is an old fashion Korean word for "kalbi" so garigukbap is beef short rib soup with rice? 

Both of our soups came out piping hot with a bowl of rice. We also got two types of banchan, radish and kimchi, which is pretty normal for establishments that specializes in soups. They don't typically give you a lot of choices for banchan .. I think it's meant to be kept simple. Both were really delicious. The kimchi isn't as garlicy as the one from TangTangTang but it is sweeter and really delicious. My spicy garibukbap was really delicious! It had napa cabbage in it and pieces of beef. It actually reminds me of yukaejang (spicy beef soup) except with better beef. I've never been a fan of the shredded beef in yukaejang. The regular garigukbap is also very tasty! It has a really nice beefy flavor to it yet it's light and very clean. 

Their mandus were huge! They were stuffed with tofu, noodles, veggies, and a little bit of meat. They serve it with two different types of dipping sauces and I believe both had a mixture of soy and vinegar. The flavor profile was really good .. it even has a little bit of spice in them for a kick. But no worries, after my spicy garibukbap, I can't even taste that the mandus have spice. 

I can't wait to come here with my friends to try their bossam. I also noticed that they serve cold jellyfish here! I definitely want to try that as well! 

Garionban opened just in time! It's the perfect weather for some piping hot, delicious soup! I definitely recommend this place!!
Clean place, great rice soup, and nice bulgogi!! When korean food required, one of the best restraunt in Las Vegas.
Great Korean restaurant. I tried lunch special 14.99. I order few times Togo too. GOOD service too

Food was great. Prices are on the steeper side but still the food was really good. We had a variety. Mandoo, soups, and bossam. Everything was great except one thing. The service. Our waters did not get refilled even once even after asking several times for more water. Our bossam came at the end of our meal. We're not sure if the server had forgot to put the order in, or if it just takes 45 min for bossam to come out. Whatever the reason, the server should have either let us know it will take long, or apologize. She didn't care. She had the "i don't want to be at work" attitude.  Everytime I looked for her, she's up at the front cashier area texting on her phone. The older server didn't bother checking up on our table once, but this young server was too busy on her phone the entire 1.5 hours we were there. I'm still leaving four stars though because I thought the food was very good.
Great Korean food and a superb galbi tang that did not leave me too dry/thirsty afterwards. I thought the wait was reasonable. It is all a bit pricey though.
New place with great taste! We ordered seokgalbi & yangneym jokbal combo. The portion was great enough for two huge-eaters. Def. coming back!

The shot rib soup and side dishes are one of the best I've tried!! People visiting Vegas who crave Korean food should definitely try this place out!! I wish they had more restaurants other than Vegas. Also, people should try out their bossam and pig feet marinated in their sweet and spicy sauce!! 5 stars!
